channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Live updates: U.S. bombers target Houthi sites in Yemen; Israel strikes Lebanon’s northeast
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Niha Masih, Leo Sands, Annabelle Timsit
item.description: The aircraft demonstrate U.S. capability to reach underground and fortified targets, Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said, adding that the bombers hit Houthi sites.

item.title: Israel issues evacuation warnings before striking northeast Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Annabelle Timsit

item.title: Israeli military appears to blow up most of Lebanese village, videos show
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Meg Kelly

item.title: China’s coast guard joins military drills, raising risk of escalation
item.dc:creator: Katrina Northrop, Vic Chiang
item.description: The world’s largest maritime law enforcement agency played an unprecedented role in Chinese military drills around Taiwan, simulating a blockade of the island.

item.title: Israel complicates election’s final stretch, an issue Democrats hoped would fade
item.dc:creator: John Hudson, Yasmeen Abutaleb, Mohamad El Chamaa, Missy Ryan

item.title: Lebanon files complaint against Israel to U.N. Security Council
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett, Leo Sands, Vivian Ho

item.title: Aid trickles into northern Gaza after U.S. warns it could withhold arms from Israel
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Frances Vinall

item.title: Israeli siege plan for Gaza under scrutiny as U.S. demands urgent change
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix, Hazem Balousha

item.title: U.S. strikes Houthi weapons sites in Yemen, deploying B-2 bombers
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Dan Lamothe

item.title: Israeli attacks on aid convoys in Gaza persist, U.N. says
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck
item.description: The Biden administration warned Israel this week that Washington could suspend military assistance if humanitarian aid flows in Gaza are not increased within a month.

item.title: U.S. strikes Houthi weapons sites in Yemen, deploying B-2 bombers
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Dan Lamothe
item.description: It was the first time the U.S. used these stealth bombers against the Houthis, who have targeted commercial and military vessels in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden.

item.title: Israel complicates election’s final stretch, an issue Democrats hoped would fade
item.dc:creator: John Hudson, Yasmeen Abutaleb, Mohamad El Chamaa, Missy Ryan
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s escalating assaults in Gaza and Lebanon have become a growing liability for Kamala Harris as Election Day nears.

item.title: Former Mexican official sentenced to 38 years in U.S. prison for taking bribes
item.dc:creator: Shayna Jacobs, Mary Beth Sheridan
item.description: Genaro García Luna was charged in U.S. District Court in Brooklyn in 2019 with acting as an enabler for the Sinaloa drug cartel.

item.title: A voyage into the world’s most contested waterway
item.dc:creator: Elana Gordon, Peter Bresnan, Reena Flores, Sean Carter, Yasmin Coles, Alan Sipress, Martin San Diego
item.description: A small flotilla, a big mission and a daunting obstacle. Today, we voyage into the most contested waterway in the world: the South China Sea.

item.title: Zelensky reveals ‘victory plan,’ calls for urgent NATO membership
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady, Kostiantyn Khudov
item.description: The plan includes permission for strikes inside Russia and assistance with air defenses, but Western reaction to it has been muted so far.

item.title: Italy sends first migrants to Albania, an offshoring model for Europe
item.dc:creator: Anthony Faiola, Zoeann Murphy
item.description: Italy’s far-right government is rolling out what it says could be a model for solving one of the West’s most politically charged problems: illegal migration.

item.title: Israel strikes southern Beirut; U.S. demands restraint in Lebanon, aid for Gaza
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett, Leo Sands, Annabelle Timsit, Vivian Ho, Bryan Pietsch, Kelsey Baker
item.description: Israeli forces targeted Beirut’s southern suburbs with airstrikes, ending several days of relative calm in the Lebanese capital.

item.title: Aid trickles into northern Gaza after U.S. warns it could withhold arms from Israel
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger

item.title: Lebanon files complaint against Israel to U.N. Security Council
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett, Leo Sands, Vivian Ho

item.title: Israeli siege plan for Gaza under scrutiny as U.S. demands urgent change
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix, Hazem Balousha

item.title: Israeli siege plan for Gaza under scrutiny as U.S. demands urgent change
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix, Hazem Balousha
item.description: The so-called “General’s Plan” is being pushed by some members of Netanyahu’s far-right government, despite pushback from the Israeli military and the White House.

item.title: Cholera case confirmed in Lebanon as U.N. warns of health risks
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch, Mohamad El Chamaa

item.title: Italy passes anti-surrogacy law that effectively bars gay couples from becoming parents
item.dc:creator: Anthony Faiola, Stefano Pitrelli
item.description: The West’s most restrictive law against international surrogacy threatens would-be parents who use birth mothers abroad with jail time and severe fines.

item.title: Israeli airstrikes resume in southern Beirut; Nabatiyeh mayor killed
item.dc:creator: Mohamad El Chamaa, Rachel Pannett, Annabelle Timsit, Vivian Ho

item.title: Immersive replica of Anne Frank’s secret annex goes to New York exhibit
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman
item.description: A walk-through replica of the rooms where the Jewish teen Anne Frank and others hid from Nazi occupiers will help a new audience to learn about antisemitism.

item.title: Weekly rally for return of hostages to resume after brief hiatus
item.dc:creator: Vivian Ho

item.title: At least 94 killed, 50 injured in fuel tanker explosion in Nigeria
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit
item.description: The driver of the tanker lost control of the vehicle, which tipped over in Nigeria’s Jigawa state. As locals rushed to retrieve the fuel, the tank exploded.

item.title: U.S. warns Israel it may withhold arms unless Gaza aid starts flowing
item.dc:creator: Missy Ryan, John Hudson, Michael Birnbaum, Karen DeYoung

item.title: As U.S. election nears, gloom settles over Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Zelensky’s victory plan will likely be a far cry from the outright “victory” many hoped for, as cynicism and fatigue set in among Ukraine’s western allies.

item.title: U.S. warns Israel arms transfers could halt unless humanitarian situation in Gaza improves
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Leo Sands, Victoria Bisset, Missy Ryan, Bryan Pietsch
item.description: Since the spring, the amount of aid delivered to Gaza “has dropped by more than 50 percent,” the United States says.

item.title: Conkers championship caught up in chestnut-of-steel cheating commotion
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Baker
item.description: “We think he’s innocent, but we’re just checking,” said a spokesman for the World Conker Championships, of allegations that the male champion swapped a chestnut for a steel nut.

item.title: U.S. warns Israel it may withhold arms unless Gaza aid starts flowing
item.dc:creator: Missy Ryan, John Hudson, Michael Birnbaum, Karen DeYoung
item.description: The Biden administration set a 30-day deadline for Israel to improve Palestinians’ access to food, medicine and other necessities.

item.title: Rare Israeli strike on northern Lebanon kills at least 21
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Tugnoli, Victoria Bisset, Lior Soroka

item.title: Second round of polio vaccinations underway in Gaza
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch

item.title: U.S. warns Israel it will withhold arms unless Gaza aid starts flowing
item.dc:creator: Missy Ryan, John Hudson, Michael Birnbaum

item.title: Six people sought new organs. They ended up with HIV.
item.dc:creator: Terrence McCoy, Marina Dias
item.description: Officials in Brazil’s well-regarded public health system are scrambling to explain this week how six transplant patients received organs infected with HIV.

item.title: Netanyahu tells U.S. Israel will strike Iranian military instead of oil or nuclear sites, officials say
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Ellen Nakashima

item.title: Netanyahu tells U.S. that Israel will strike Iranian military, not nuclear or oil, targets, officials say
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Ellen Nakashima
item.description: The signal is being seen in Washington as a sign of restraint after concerns that an Israeli strike on oil or nuclear facilities could trigger a wider war.

item.title: Hezbollah official says all of Israel is a target after attacks in Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Mohamad El Chamaa, Bryan Pietsch

item.title: ‘Stunning’ hidden tomb found at Petra site featured in ‘Indiana Jones’
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit
item.description: Underneath the Treasury in Petra, Jordan, archaeologists found remains and a ceramic vessel some said looked similar to the “Holy Grail” depicted in “Indiana Jones.”

item.title: What to know about U.S. military support for Israel after a year of war
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor, Leo Sands, Kelly Kasulis Cho, Adela Suliman

item.title: Russian father jailed for his daughter’s antiwar drawing is released
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon, Natalia Abbakumova
item.description: Alexei Moskalyov’s daughter Masha was waiting for him at the gates of the penal colony where he served a year and a half for “discrediting” the Russian army.

item.title: Rescuers still searching for missing under rubble in north Gaza
item.dc:creator: Victoria Bisset

item.title: As Israeli war on Hezbollah expands, rescuers in east reach their limit
item.dc:creator: Susannah George
item.description: Israel’s military campaign, largely concentrated in southern Lebanon, has reached the Bekaa Valley, where deadly airstrikes often come without warning.

item.title: U.N. Security Council expresses ‘strong concerns’ after peacekeepers hit
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands

item.title: Trump wants a U.S. wealth fund that surpasses Norway’s. Some Norwegians aren’t sold.
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor
item.description: Trump and the Biden White House both say the United States should have a sovereign wealth fund. Norway, home to the world’s largest, may offer a few lessons.
